channel.title: Illegal start of expression
channel.description:
just got finsihed fixing 99 errors, and i need some help with this one. this is my third topic but no1 will respond. just say something ffs. here is the prob.
[img]http://img404.imageshack.us/img404/9867/1compileerrorlj3.png[/img]
please someone help here.

[quote=“the reaper77, post:7, topic:232530”]It changes your level by xp.

example:

player’s xp is 83. that will make it so their level is 2 :P[/quote]

cool to know, but still doesnt help with the error lol :P.

item.title: Illegal start of expression
item.dc:creator: @jb_blaze jb blaze
item.description:
@jb_blaze wrote:

i did check for erros above it. and i cant see anything out of order. evrything seems fine.
as for what project said, its not what its doing that i care about its what it is :P.

ok so at the bottom of the code is the error, the “human attack” stuff WAS an error that i fixed. is there a problem there? there wasnt any ; at the end and no parentheses.

[code][ server.playerHandler.players[Player].removeequipped();
}
} else {
if (npcs[NPCID].animNumber = 0x326) //human attack

                                           server.playerHandler.players[Player].setPlrAnimation(server.playerHandler.players[Player].GetPlrBlockAnim(server.playerHandler.players[Player].playerEquipment[server.playerHandler.players[Player].playerWeapon]));
					npcs[NPCID].animUpdateRequired = true;                                              
					npcs[NPCID].updateRequired = true;
					if ((EnemyHP - hitDiff) < 0) {
						hitDiff = EnemyHP;
					}
					server.playerHandler.players[Player].hitDiff = hitDiff;
					server.playerHandler.players[Player].updateRequired = true;
					server.playerHandler.players[Player].hitUpdateRequired = true;
					server.playerHandler.players[Player].appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
					npcs[NPCID].actionTimer = 7;
				}
			}
			return true;
		}
	}
	return false;
}                	                   
                                                             
public int getLevelForXP(int XP) {[/code]

Read full topic
